snippet: As Syria’s war drags on, families are being forced by deepening poverty and hardship to resort to more desperate survival strategies, including marrying off their young children or forcing them to work, the United Nations said.
abstract: United Nations reports that over four million Syrians have fled into neighboring countries to escape civil war, creating biggest refugee population from single conflict in a generation; UN official warns that international aid is failing to keep pace with crisis and many refugees are sliding deeper into poverty.
lead_paragraph: As Syria’s war drags on, families are being forced by deepening poverty and hardship to resort to more desperate survival strategies, including marrying off their young children or forcing them to work, the United Nations said.

headline.main: Number of Syrian Refugees Climbs to More Than 4 Million
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Middle East; More Than 4 Million Have Fled Syria, U.N. Says
